Are antivirus software warnings about this software always accurate and indicative of a real threat?

No, Avast and Kaspersky may flag the software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP", which are warnings that the software is mining software and may be installed by a third party to exploit your PC. However, these warnings are false positives and the software is not actually a virus or malware.

Avast and Kaspersky may flag the software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP". These are warnings that you are installing mining software, which may be installed by a third party to exploit your PC.
To find out more about the false positives, review the following resources:
https://blog.malwarebytes.com/detections/pup-optional-bitcoinminer/
https://www.kaspersky.com/blog/not-a-virus/18015/
